verses.kjv: Now it came to pass in the third year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, that Hezekiah the son of Ahaz king of Judah began to reign.
verses.ct: During the 3rd year of Hoshea son of Elah, king of Israel, Hezekiah son of Ahaz, king of Judah, became king.

verses.kjv: Twenty and five years old was he when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name also was Abi, the daughter of Zachariah.
verses.ct: He was 25 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 29 years. His mother's name was Abi, the daughter of Zachariah.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, according to all that David his father did.
verses.ct: He did what was right in the LORD's judgment, just as his ancestor David had done.

verses.kjv: He removed the high places, and brake the images, and cut down the groves, and brake in pieces the brasen serpent that Moses had made: for unto those days the children of Israel did burn incense to it: and he called it Nehushtan.
verses.ct: He tore down the worship shrines on the hills, smashed the sacred pillars, chopped down the Asherah poles, and broke apart the bronze snake that Moses had made, because up to that time the Israelites had been burning incense to it. He called it Nehushtan.

verses.kjv: He trusted in the LORD God of Israel; so that after him was none like him among all the kings of Judah, nor any that were before him.
verses.ct: He put his trust in the LORD, the God of Israel. Among all the kings of Judah, there was no one like him — neither those who came after him nor those who came before him.

verses.kjv: For he clave to the LORD, and departed not from following him, but kept his commandments, which the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: He held firmly to the LORD and never stopped following him, and he obeyed the commands that the LORD had given to Moses.

verses.kjv: And the LORD was with him; and he prospered whithersoever he went forth: and he rebelled against the king of Assyria, and served him not.
verses.ct: The LORD was with him, and he succeeded in everything he undertook. He also rebelled against the king of Assyria and refused to serve him.

verses.kjv: He smote the Philistines, even unto Gaza, and the borders thereof, from the tower of the watchmen to the fenced city.
verses.ct: He defeated the Philistines all the way to Gaza and its surrounding territory, from the smallest watchtower to the largest fortified city.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the fourth year of king Hezekiah, which was the seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, that Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against Samaria, and besieged it.
verses.ct: In the 4th year of King Hezekiah's reign — which was the 7th year of Hoshea son of Elah, king of Israel — Shalmaneser king of Assyria marched against Samaria and laid siege to it.

verses.kjv: And at the end of three years they took it: even in the sixth year of Hezekiah, that is the ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel, Samaria was taken.
verses.ct: After 3 years, they captured it. So in the 6th year of Hezekiah — that is, the 9th year of Hoshea king of Israel — Samaria fell.

verses.kjv: And the king of Assyria did carry away Israel unto Assyria, and put them in Halah and in Habor by the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes:
verses.ct: The king of Assyria deported the Israelites to Assyria and settled them in Halah, along the Habor River in Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes.

verses.kjv: Because they obeyed not the voice of the LORD their God, but transgressed his covenant, and all that Moses the servant of the LORD commanded, and would not hear them, nor do them.
verses.ct: This happened because they refused to obey the LORD their God. They violated his covenant and everything that Moses, the servant of the LORD, had commanded. They would not listen or obey.

verses.kjv: Now in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah did Sennacherib king of Assyria come up against all the fenced cities of Judah, and took them.
verses.ct: In the 14th year of King Hezekiah's reign, Sennacherib king of Assyria attacked all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah king of Judah sent to the king of Assyria to Lachish, saying, I have offended; return from me: that which thou puttest on me will I bear. And the king of Assyria appointed unto Hezekiah king of Judah three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold.
verses.ct: Hezekiah king of Judah sent a message to the king of Assyria at Lachish, saying, "I was wrong to rebel. Withdraw from me, and I will pay whatever you demand." The king of Assyria required Hezekiah king of Judah to pay 300 talents of silver and 30 talents of gold.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah gave him all the silver that was found in the house of the LORD, and in the treasures of the king’s house.
verses.ct: Hezekiah handed over all the silver that could be found in the LORD's temple and in the royal treasury.

verses.kjv: At that time did Hezekiah cut off the gold from the doors of the temple of the LORD, and from the pillars which Hezekiah king of Judah had overlaid, and gave it to the king of Assyria.
verses.ct: At that time, Hezekiah stripped the gold from the doors of the LORD's temple and from the doorposts that he himself had overlaid with gold, and he gave it all to the king of Assyria.

verses.kjv: And the king of Assyria sent Tartan and Rabsaris and Rabshakeh from Lachish to king Hezekiah with a great host against Jerusalem. And they went up and came to Jerusalem. And when they were come up, they came and stood by the conduit of the upper pool, which is in the highway of the fuller’s field.
verses.ct: Then the king of Assyria sent his commanding general, his chief officer, and his chief cup-bearer from Lachish to King Hezekiah in Jerusalem with a massive army. They marched up and arrived at Jerusalem, taking a position by the aqueduct of the upper pool, along the road to the washerman's field.

verses.kjv: And when they had called to the king, there came out to them Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, which was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder.
verses.ct: When they called for the king, Eliakim son of Hilkiah, the palace administrator, came out to meet them, along with Shebna the royal secretary and Joah son of Asaph, the court recorder.

verses.kjv: And Rabshakeh said unto them, Speak ye now to Hezekiah, Thus saith the great king, the king of Assyria, What confidence is this wherein thou trustest?
verses.ct: The Rabshakeh told them, "Deliver this message to Hezekiah: The great king, the king of Assyria, asks — what are you basing your confidence on?"

verses.kjv: Thou sayest, (but they are but vain words,) I have counsel and strength for the war. Now on whom dost thou trust, that thou rebellest against me?
verses.ct: "You claim to have strategy and military strength for war — but those are just empty words. Who exactly are you relying on that you dare to rebel against me?"

verses.kjv: Now, behold, thou trustest upon the staff of this bruised reed, even upon Egypt, on which if a man lean, it will go into his hand, and pierce it: so is Pharaoh king of Egypt unto all that trust on him.
verses.ct: "Look, you are depending on Egypt — a splintered walking stick! If anyone leans on it, it stabs right through their hand. That's exactly what Pharaoh king of Egypt is like to everyone who relies on him."

verses.kjv: But if ye say unto me, We trust in the LORD our God: is not that he, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath taken away, and hath said to Judah and Jerusalem, Ye shall worship before this altar in Jerusalem?
verses.ct: "And if you tell me, 'We are trusting in the LORD our God' — isn't he the one whose hilltop shrines and altars Hezekiah removed, telling Judah and Jerusalem, 'You must worship only at this altar in Jerusalem'?"

verses.kjv: Now therefore, I pray thee, give pledges to my lord the king of Assyria, and I will deliver thee two thousand horses, if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them.
verses.ct: "So here's a challenge: make a wager with my master, the king of Assyria. I'll give you 2,000 horses — if you can even find enough riders to put on them!"

verses.kjv: How then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master’s servants, and put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?
verses.ct: "How could you possibly repel even one of the lowest-ranking officers serving my master? And yet you're counting on Egypt for chariots and cavalry!"

verses.kjv: Am I now come up without the LORD against this place to destroy it? The LORD said to me, Go up against this land, and destroy it.
verses.ct: "Besides, do you think I came to attack and destroy this place without the LORD's approval? The LORD himself told me, 'March against this land and destroy it.'"

verses.kjv: Then said Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, and Shebna, and Joah, unto Rabshakeh, Speak, I pray thee, to thy servants in the Syrian language; for we understand it: and talk not with us in the Jews’ language in the ears of the people that are on the wall.
verses.ct: Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah, along with Shebna and Joah, said to the Rabshakeh, "Please speak to us in Aramaic — we understand it. Don't speak to us in Hebrew where the people on the wall can hear you."

verses.kjv: But Rabshakeh said unto them, Hath my master sent me to thy master, and to thee, to speak these words? hath he not sent me to the men which sit on the wall, that they may eat their own dung, and drink their own piss with you?
verses.ct: But the Rabshakeh replied, "Do you think my master sent me to say these things only to your master and to you? He sent me to speak to the men sitting on that wall too — the ones who will end up eating their own dung and drinking their own urine along with you!"

verses.kjv: Then Rabshakeh stood and cried with a loud voice in the Jews’ language, and spake, saying, Hear the word of the great king, the king of Assyria:
verses.ct: Then the Rabshakeh stood up and shouted loudly in Hebrew, "Listen to the message of the great king, the king of Assyria!"

verses.kjv: Thus saith the king, Let not Hezekiah deceive you: for he shall not be able to deliver you out of his hand:
verses.ct: "This is what the king says: Don't let Hezekiah fool you, because he cannot rescue you from my power."

verses.kjv: Neither let Hezekiah make you trust in the LORD, saying, The LORD will surely deliver us, and this city shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.
verses.ct: "And don't let Hezekiah convince you to trust in the LORD by saying, 'The LORD will certainly save us — this city will never be handed over to the king of Assyria.'"

verses.kjv: Hearken not to Hezekiah: for thus saith the king of Assyria, Make an agreement with me by a present, and come out to me, and then eat ye every man of his own vine, and every one of his fig tree, and drink ye every one the waters of his cistern:
verses.ct: "Don't listen to Hezekiah! This is what the king of Assyria says: Make peace with me and surrender. Then each of you will eat from your own grapevine and your own fig tree, and drink water from your own well,"

verses.kjv: Until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a land of bread and vineyards, a land of oil olive and of honey, that ye may live, and not die: and hearken not unto Hezekiah, when he persuadeth you, saying, The LORD will deliver us.
verses.ct: "until I come and relocate you to a land just like yours — a land with grain and wine, a land with bread and vineyards, a land with olive oil and honey. Choose life instead of death! Don't listen to Hezekiah when he tries to persuade you by saying, 'The LORD will save us.'"

verses.kjv: Hath any of the gods of the nations delivered at all his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
verses.ct: "Has the god of any nation ever rescued its land from the power of the king of Assyria?"

verses.kjv: Where are the gods of Hamath, and of Arpad? where are the gods of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah? have they delivered Samaria out of mine hand?
verses.ct: "Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah? Did they rescue Samaria from my power?"

verses.kjv: Who are they among all the gods of the countries, that have delivered their country out of mine hand, that the LORD should deliver Jerusalem out of mine hand?
verses.ct: "Among all the gods of these countries, which one has ever saved its land from my power? So why would the LORD be able to save Jerusalem from me?"

verses.kjv: But the people held their peace, and answered him not a word: for the king’s commandment was, saying, Answer him not.
verses.ct: But the people stayed silent and didn't say a single word in response, because the king had given strict orders: "Do not answer him."

verses.kjv: Then came Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, which was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder, to Hezekiah with their clothes rent, and told him the words of Rabshakeh.
verses.ct: Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah, the palace administrator, along with Shebna the royal secretary and Joah son of Asaph, the court recorder, went to Hezekiah with their clothes torn in grief and reported everything the Rabshakeh had said.
